nodes.text: The solar pike was a variant of Thyrsian pike used for ritual combat by the Sun Guard, a feared military unit and Sith cult from the planet Thyrsus that held the pike as a near-sacred weapon. Inherited from the Thyrsians' Echani cousins, the polearm was approximately one meter long and was wielded with two hands, providing the means to block incoming strikes and attack with the blades on either end of the pike. The solar pike featured conductive tips, which were activated through its grip controls and glowed red-hot.
The solar pike was first mentioned in Galaxy at War, a 2009 Star Wars Legends supplement for the Wizards of the Coast Star Wars Roleplaying Game.

It was first identified in the second entry of Star Wars: The Essential Guide to Warfare Author's Cut, a twelve-part blog series presenting cut material from The Essential Guide to Warfare. The entry was entitled "Ancient Coruscant," written by Jason Fry and Paul R. Urquhart and published on StarWars.com in 2013.
